text.en: Harvey gets a $50 commission every time he makes a sale  (=sells something as part of his job).
Car salesmen will often bring down the price rather than lose a sale  (=fail to sell something).
arms sales to Iran
The use and sale of marijuana remains illegal.
sale of

definition.en: a period of time when shops sell their goods at lower prices than usual

text.en: Marsdon’s department store is having a sale this week.
I picked up some real bargains in the January sales this year.
the sales

definition.en: an event at which things are sold to the person who offers the highest price

text.en: a sale of 17th-century paintings
A salesman may communicate perfectly well with a customer but fail to make a sale.
Harry lost the sale because he was not persistent enough.
He wants a quick sale, so he might reduce the price.
The company has reported continuing strong sales.
Sales for the first three months of this year were disappointing.
The Ford Fiesta has achieved record sales in Italy.
Car sales have fallen every month for the past two years.
The company has annual sales of over $300 million.
Worldwide sales of wine are increasing.
The volume of retail sales was 0.3 percent higher than in the previous quarter.
Export sales rose for the sixth consecutive month.
Last month saw record high-street sales.
Sales rose by 9% last year.
European sales have fallen by 12%.
Sales are expected to improve over the coming year.
Computer sales soared as prices continued to come down.
Meat sales have slumped following the most recent health scare.
The company said its sales figures continued to show growth.
It achieved only 20% of its sales target.
The sales force had grown from 40 to 270.
There has been an encouraging improvement in sales performance.
The sales forecast is for a 12% increase in sales over the current year.
The company is expecting a 20% increase in sales next year.
Some jobs may be cut following a big drop in sales.
Because of its high volume of sales, the company can keep prices low.

definition.en: the act of selling someone property, food, or other goods

text.en: Tickets go on sale (=become available to buy) later this week.
The public protested at the sale of land for industrial development.
sale of
A house sale may be completed in four weeks.
sale of
Every time we make a sale, I get $50 commission.
sale of
Rather than lose a sale, car salesmen will often bring down the price.
sale of
Executives said the firm may be for sale.
We don’t have a for sale sign up outside the building.
She recently put her house up for sale.

definition.en: available for a short time at a reduced price

text.en: I bought a set of iron skillets on sale for $8.99.

definition.en: a period of time when a shop sells its goods at lower prices than usual

text.en: The drugstore downtown is having a sale, and some things are down to half price.

definition.en: when shops are selling their goods at lower prices than usual

text.en: You might be able to get a cheap bed in the sales.
The cost of footwear was reduced by 12% at the January sales.

definition.en: an event at which things are sold, especially to the person who offers the highest price

text.en: a sale of 17th century paintings
sale of

definition.en: the total number of products that a company sells during a particular period of time

text.en: We grossed more than £500,000 in sales last year.
The rate of sales growth slowed in the second half of the year.
They’ve already reached their sales targets for this year.
Do you have this month’s sales figures?

definition.en: the part of a company that deals with selling products

text.en: I’d like to work in sales.
She is director of sales and marketing.
a sales manager
